Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the article published in Europhysics News is not a scientific article but contains speculation.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the collapse of the Twin Towers and World Trade Center Building 7 was the result of a controlled demolition, which goes against the official conclusion of the NIST Investigation.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation provided by the NIST Investigation, which attributes the collapse to the structural failure caused by burning jet fuel.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the European Scientific Journal and the European Scientific Institute have not published any content on the 9/11 attacks, as clarified by their statement.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times as it relies on a news feature published in Europhysics News, which includes speculation and is not a purely scientific article.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of the Europhysics News feature by presenting it as a stronger validation than previously published conspiracy theories, even though it is not a scientific article.
Understate: No biases of understatement are evident in the provided claim.
